channel.title: CSIS — Analysis (custom RSS)
channel.description: Auto-generated RSS feed for CSIS Analysis pages.

item.title: Ahead of APEC, Trump Signs Flurry of Bilateral Minerals Agreements on Asia Tour
item.description: Leading up to the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in South Korea, President Trump signed new bilateral minerals agreements between the United States and Australia, Japan, Malaysia, and Thailand, marking an escalation in minerals diversification efforts.

item.title: Six Months Since the U.S.-Ukraine Minerals Deal Was Signed—What Now?
item.description: Six months ago, the U.S. and Ukraine launched the Reconstruction Investment Fund, placing critical minerals at its core to advance Ukraine’s economic recovery and enhance U.S. minerals security. What progress has been made to date, and what key actions are still required?

item.title: Can the United States Immediately Return to Nuclear Testing?
item.description: President Trump’s post raises technical questions about how and if the United States could “immediately” return to nuclear testing, and political considerations about the signaling behind nuclear testing and who would benefit most from a return to testing.

item.title: AI Needs Its Complements: Investing in the Next Wave of Innovation
item.description: As the United States advances its AI investments, it must also back complementary technologies that boost capability and ease resource limits. Quantum computing can overcome key constraints, helping the nation sustain innovation and long-term technological leadership.

item.title: U.S. Universities: Engines of Economic Growth
item.description: University research is a proven job creator, an engine of regional economic growth, and a generator of entirely new industries that also advance public health, improve wellbeing, and bolster national security.

item.title: After Argentina’s Midterms, a New Chapter for U.S.-Argentina Relations
item.description: CSIS Americas associate fellow Henry Ziemer and Henry Large argue that U.S. support for Argentina may provide a template for how Washington can compete with China in Latin America.

item.title: States Weekly: October 29, 2025
item.description: This edition of States Weekly covers October 29, 2025.

item.title: CSIS Launches Initiative to Strengthen U.S.-Africa Policy Dialogue
item.description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) today announced it is launching a peer-to-peer forum that connects African think tanks, academic centers, and research institutions directly with U.S.-based policy conversations.

item.title: Demining Ukraine: Outcomes from the 2025 Ukraine Mine Action Conference
item.description: The CSIS Global Food and Water Security Program welcomed Ambassador of Ukraine to the United States Olga Stefanishyna and a panel of experts to discuss facilitating expedient, safe demining procedures at scale for Ukraine’s agricultural recovery.
